page.title: 03Finedon The Dutch Doll
page.content: The old Girls Charity School,founded in 1712, now a private house, was once the home of the Dutch Doll.The punishment most dreaded by the children was to be locked in the cellar with the doll.She was called the Dutch Doll because her hat looked like the Dutch National Costume.In fact she probably resembled the Charity Girls in their uniform. There are many legends about her, one is that her feet were cut off because she walked at night.They also say that she was fixed to some mechanism so that if anybody opened the door she moved. The doll was kept in the church when the school moved but it was stolen in 1981.Local people were angry and upset. The police still have not traced the figure.
